actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 101-318.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 201.
Mr. Sharp moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Mr. Moorhead demanded a second on the motion to suspend the rules.
On ordering a second Agreed to without objection.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Laid on the table. See S. 750 for further action.

official_title: To extend the deadlines under the Federal Power Act applicable to the construction of a hydroelectric project in the State of Washington.

summary.text: Authorizes the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to extend, for up to three consecutive two-year periods, the time required for specified licensees to commence construction on certain small hydroelectric generation facilities located in: (1) Independence County, Arkansas; and (2) Whatcom and Lewis Counties, Washington.

titles.title: To extend the deadlines under the Federal Power Act applicable to the construction of a hydroelectric project in the State of Washington.
